article.headline: U.S. import prices rose for third straight month in July
article.body: U.S. import prices rose 0.7% in July, the third straight monthly gain, the Labor Department said Thursday. The increase in import prices over the past three months is the largest since 2011. Despite this advance, import prices declined 3.3% over the past year. The gain in July was led by fuel prices, which rose 6.9% in July. The gains over the past three months in imported fuel prices is the largest since 1990. Still, fuel prices are down 32.8% over the past 12 months. Import prices excluding fuels rose 0.2% in July. Export prices rose 0.8% in July and are down 4.4% over the past year.
